name: str::traits::<impl slice::index::SliceIndex<str> for (ops::range::Bound<usize>, ops::range::Bound<usize>)>::get_mut

str::<impl str>::len.doc:
Returns the length of `self`.

 This length is in bytes, not [`char`]s or graphemes. In other words,
 it might not be what a human considers the length of the string.

 [`char`]: prim@char

 # Examples

 ```
 let len = "foo".len();
 assert_eq!(3, len);

 assert_eq!("ƒoo".len(), 4); // fancy f!
 assert_eq!("ƒoo".chars().count(), 3);
 ```

slice::index::into_range.doc:
Converts pair of `ops::Bound`s into `ops::Range`.
 Returns `None` on overflowing indices.

slice::index::SliceIndex::get_mut.doc:
Returns a mutable reference to the output at this location, if in
 bounds.
